This code implements a Lagrangean relaxation scheme for the multi-item multi-period capacitated lot sizing problem.

class dw2.DantzigWolfe(inp)[source]¶

Bases: object

add_column_to_master(inp, item, q)[source]¶

Note: “q” is the index of the convex set of dominated solutions. q = 0 –> undominated WW solution

add_dominated_column_to_master(inp, item, q)[source]¶
column_generation(inp, u, alpha, theta)[source]¶
compute_rc(inp, item, y, x, s, u, alpha)[source]¶
define_master(inp)[source]¶

Define the master problem and include the column corresponding to an arbitrarily high initial inventory (s_{j0}), with high cost. This ensures that a feasible solution is always available.

define_ulsp(inp)[source]¶
dw_cycle(inp)[source]¶
get_columns(inp, item, u, alpha)[source]¶
get_master_solution(inp)[source]¶
initialize_multipliers(inp)[source]¶
solve_ulsp(inp, u, alpha, theta, item)[source]¶

Solve ULS for a given set of multipliers u and alpha. The item for which this problem is solved is given in “item”.
